key_insight: GaMO uses a geometry-aware multi-view diffusion outpainting model to synthesize novel views that respect camera poses and scene geometry, enabling accurate 3D reconstruction from very sparse input views.
problem_solved: Improves 3D reconstruction quality when only a few input images are available by producing geometry-consistent, multi-view augmentations that fill coverage gaps and reduce reconstruction artifacts.
method: Geometry-aware diffusion outpainting: condition a diffusion model on sparse input views + camera poses to generate novel, view-consistent images.
Multi-view geometric constraints: enforce depth/pose/epipolar consistency and multi-view losses to keep synthesized views physically plausible.
Integration with reconstruction pipeline: augment inputs (or jointly optimize) for downstream MVS/NeRF-style 3D reconstruction to produce higher-fidelity geometry from few views.
impact: Enables robust 3D scene capture with far fewer photographs, lowering data-collection cost and improving reconstruction reliability for AR/VR, robotics, and 3D content workflows.
visual_elements: Pipeline diagram: sparse input images + camera poses → GaMO diffusion outpainting → augmented views → 3D reconstruction output
Before/after comparison: reconstruction from raw sparse views vs. reconstruction after GaMO augmentation
Geometry consistency illustration: camera frustums, depth maps or epipolar lines showing constrained synthesis
Performance chart: reconstruction accuracy (e.g., IoU/Chamfer/PSNR) vs. number of input views comparing GaMO and baselines
paper_title: GaMO: Geometry-aware Multi-view Diffusion Outpainting for Sparse-View 3D Reconstruction
paper_authors: Yi-Chuan Huang, Hao-Jen Chien, Chin-Yang Lin, Ying-Huan Chen, Yu-Lun Liu
